The Defense Department pushed early on "to do what we'd done in Afghanistan" - where a tribal loya jirga had quickly anointed Hamid Karzai as leader. The goal was to move quickly to have an Iraqi face on the leadership in the country, as opposed to a foreign occupation. Mr. Donald Rumsfeld 's early takeaway from NSC meetings was that "the George H. W. Bush agreed." Yet Colin Powell 's State Department was adamantly opposed.
